place.name: MEOLE BRACE
place.gazetteerText: BRACE-MEOLE, a parish in Shrewsbury district, Salop; on the Shrewsbury and Hereford railway, 1 mile S of Shrewsbury. It is partly within Shrewsbury borough; includes the townships of Newton and Edgbold, Nobold, and part of Pulley; and contains the Shrewsbury workhouse and the Kingsland lunatic asylum. Post Town, Shrewsbury. Pop., 1,215. Houses, 260. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Hereford. Value, £425.* Patron, J. Bather, Esq. The church was rebuilt in 1869, at a cost of £.4,500. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
